questions.question: Not until that day …………………………. able to recover her confidence.
questions.description: When not until comes at the beginning, we use an inverted word order.

questions.question: Can I stay …………………….. Saturday?
questions.description: We use until to talk about a situation that will continue up to a certain moment.

questions.question: I can repair your stereo …………………………….. Friday.
questions.description: We use by to say that an action will happen at a future moment.

questions.question: The nearest supermarket is about half a mile …………………………… the highway.
questions.description: Sometimes both up and down can be used to mean along or further on.

questions.question: You surprised ……………………………
questions.description: There is no preposition between surprise and its verb.

questions.question: We …………………………….. the railway station in half an hour.
questions.description: There is no preposition after reach.

questions.question: I am going to ……………………….. Mary some flowers.
questions.description: Buy can be followed by a direct object and an indirect object. There is no preposition when the indirect object goes before the direct object.

questions.question: Let’s …………………………. your plans.
questions.description: Some verbs need a preposition before their object.

questions.question: Why are you staring ………………………. like that?
questions.description: Some verbs need a preposition before their object.

questions.question: ……………………….. I am going to jump over the stream.
questions.description: The preposition is dropped when there is no object.

questions.question: We arrived ……………………………… the station in the morning.
questions.description: A preposition is usually used before an expression of place.
